author: tersec
content:
can get into more detail later, but basically Nimbus gets confused by what it regards as an inconsistent eth1 chain:
```
1025867:ERR 2025-04-29 12:15:36.138+00:00 The Eth1 chain is in inconsistent state    topics="elchain"
```
which comes from specifically the block
```
DBG 2025-04-29 06:10:24.066+00:00 Block resolved                             topics="gossip_blocks" blockRoot=355eab6e blck="(slot: 4097, proposer_index: 877, parent_root: \"fd0738f4\", state_root: \"df82f200\", eth1data: (deposit_root: 270ca05ff34b115f97a883a911e7ebd5f90d080681e118b384ff1d6d9ddeb651, deposit_count: 2032963, block_hash: ec2a6ab842c9058f08b29dd1828605612c19cc9197b90997720cc8ba09a04d4c), graffiti: \"lighthouse-nethermind-1\", proposer_slashings_len: 0, attester_slashings_len: 0, attestations_len: 1, deposits_len: 0, voluntary_exits_len: 0, sync_committee_participants: 512, block_number: 22363415, block_hash: \"0xed99e0ee66dfd73c5e10dbd4452ab735e503e7627dfe2d966fdaeb5bbab4ef6b\", parent_hash: \"0x9370c0e729e4f68937448927a5c29986167657850d4020652e689a3026d4be46\", fee_recipient: \"0xf97e180c050e5ab072211ad2c213eb5aee4df134\", bls_to_execution_changes_len: 0, blob_kzg_commitments_len: 0)" executionValid=true heads=1 stateDataDur=39us561ns sigVerifyDur=3ms129us245ns stateVerifyDur=1ms471us597ns putBlockDur=681us351ns epochRefDur=11us166ns
```

author: tersec
content: where the `deposit_count` jumps from 0 to 2032963

author: nishant0
content:
we had the same issue:
https://discord.com/channels/595666850260713488/1366516735469031654/1366665709199036447

The eth1data in the genesis state is invalid which causes problems for us

author: tersec
content:
ah, didn't see that thread, alright, basically I'll stop spamming here then and just say that the codepaths to get to this particular failure mode in Nimbus are .... guarded? by multiple comments of the form of:
```nim
        error "The Eth1 chain is in inconsistent state" # This should not really happen
        result.hasMissingDeposits = true
```
and
```nim
  # A valid state should never have this condition, but it doesn't hurt
  # to be extra defensive here because we are working with uint types
  var pendingDepositsCount = if stateDepositsCount > stateDepositIdx:
    stateDepositsCount - stateDepositIdx
  else:
    0
```
